team.cascade.spout.makememod.helper
Class Messenger

Object
  Messenger

public final class Messenger
extends Object

The following Methods are some helpers for command handling, support guessing of commands, message formatting etc
Allows sending of messages in a formatted way and allows replacing of variables which are wrapped in %(variable).
The following variables are included by default:
%(player), %(realName), %(world), %(loc)
The following <br> will force a line break.

Version:
$FullVersion$
Author:
$Author: dredhorse$

wrap

public static String wrap(Object toString)
Makes a Object toString yellow, with a trailing green colour.

Parameters:
toString - Object which toString output should be wrapped
Returns:
toString expression of the Object with wrapped colours

wrap

public static String wrap(Chat_Styles wrap,
                          Object toString,
                          Chat_Styles trail)
Makes a Object toString with a certain CHAT_STYLES and adds a trailing ChatColour.

Parameters:
wrap - @CHAT_STYLES which is used to color the toString
toString - Object which toString output should be wrapped
trail - @CHAT_STYLES which is added at the end of the string
Returns:
toString expression of the Object with wrapped colours

replaceVariables

public static String replaceVariables(String message,
                                      String variable,
                                      String replacement)
Simple method to replace variables in a string Will catch any Exception and logs them in console. If Exception occurs. message is returned without replacement.

Parameters:
message - to translate, for example "Hello %player"
variable - to replace, for example %player
replacement - which replaces variable, for example dredhorse
Returns:
changedMessage messages with replaced values, for example "Hello dredhorse"

dictFormat

public static String dictFormat(String format,
                                Hashtable<String,Object> values)
Taken from http://stackoverflow.com/a/2295004
Allows you to pass a hashtable with the format String, Object where String represents %(variable) which is than replaced by the toString expression of the object. See also getPlayerDict(org.spout.api.player.Player)

Parameters:
format - string to format
values - %(variable) and replacement values in hashtable
Returns:
string with replaced text

getPlayerDict

public static Hashtable<String,Object> getPlayerDict(Player player)
Creates a hashtable with holds the default information values normally used when replacing text concerning a player. dictFormat(String, java.util.Hashtable)

Parameters:
player - to retrieve information from
Returns:
replacement values for %(player), %(realName), %(world), %(loc)
